page.title: 01LOCH GLOW
page.content: This area which lies 6km north east of Dunfermline in central Fife is an undulating region with several small hills and ranges in height from 188m to the east of Roscobie reservoir to 282m at Craigencrow. Several small burns run eastwards through the central area. An outcrop of columnar basalt is found at Craigencrow Craigs. This was quarried in the past but is now used mainly as a dump. Most of the land is owned by the forestry commission and recent planting has taken place on the Roscobie Muir. Farming, mainly hill sheep and cattle is the second most important economic activity. In the north of the area lies Loch Glow- a local authority reservoir.This is no longer connected to the public supply but is an important angling amenity.
